column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: As part of SGH's annual strategic planning process, each business reviews and renews its assessment of the potential impacts of climate change on its business. At the Group level, an exercise includes considering potential technological and regulatory changes in SGH's portfolio of businesses and investments and potential future opportunities.
column20: Climate change assessment, strategic planning process, future opportunity

Approach to tax
column13: SGH's tax strategy is based on its commitment to building sustained shareholder value through high-quality tax management, ensuring the Group's compliance with revenue laws and preserving and enhancing the Company's integrity and reputation. SGH seeks to meet all tax compliance obligations and apply sound tax risk management principles within the Board-approved tax risk management framework consistent with the Group's overall risk framework.
column20: Tax strategy, tax management, shareholder value

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column7: SGH continues to be mindful of its corporate governance responsibilities and takes a proactive approach to ensuring that it stays at the forefront of corporate governance practices. Tax governance and risk management are key priorities of the SGH Board and SGH Management.

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column7: A fundamental tenet of SGH's commitment to governance is the Group's transparent and cooperative relationship with the Australian Taxation Office ("ATO") and other relevant tax authorities on a range of issues as part of the ongoing activities of the Group.

column6: Country-by-country reporting
column7: The Group's international related-party dealings remain very limited. SGH Group always seeks to ensure that it complies with the regulatory requirements of each of the jurisdictions in which it operates and, therefore, seeks to price its international related party dealings on an arm's length basis.

column6: Materials used by weight or volume
column13: WesTrac has 'rebuild' teams in multiple workshops, specialising in taking fully used equipment and rebuilding each component to an 'as new' state. Throughout FY23, WesTrac rebuilt almost 200 large mining trucks and other machines. WesTrac supplied its customers with over 68,000 rebuilt components and parts in its local rebuild operations, including over 10,000 components.

column6: Recycled input materials used
column13: WesTrac is reviewing the state of sustainability within its procurement practices and is working towards embedding sustainability as a key criterion within this process. For example, over FY23, WesTrac worked with its packaging supplier to ensure it maximised its use of recycled cardboard boxes wherever possible and practical.
column20: Recycled cardboard, state of sustainability, procurement practice
